article_node.title: Even at an All-Time High, The Vanguard S&P 500 ETF Isn't as Expensive as It Seems
article_node.summary: The S&P 500 index has seen significant valuation increases due to strong growth in recent years, particularly among its more growth-oriented components, which has led to a less diversified and more volatile index. Despite its high forward price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 22.2, compared to historical averages, the index may still be justified as companies become more efficient and reinvest profits for growth. Additionally, the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF, while currently at an all-time high, is considered a viable investment option, although analysts suggest exploring other stocks that may offer better returns.
